channel.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
channel.description: I'm considering lowering the number of sponsored server positions that are sold each month, in the past it has always been 10, and I'm thinking of lowering it to 5 to see what happens. What do you guys think about that?

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:40, topic:365368”][quote author=John459 link=topic=461573.msg3379386#msg3379386 date=1287895049]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461573.msg3379382#msg3379382 date=1287894254]

[quote author=John459 link=topic=461573.msg3379380#msg3379380 date=1287894085]

Maybe you should stop wasting your time creating private servers?
[/quote]Why are you here if you think private servers are a waste of time?

I, like all of you, had once wasted my time too. Also these forums have more than just a private server section to offer.
[/quote]If you are not here for the private servers, perhaps you should try MoparIsTheBest.com/smf. It has everything that this forum offers and more, except private servers.

I occasionally post there as well.
[/quote]Please read the banner of this site, and then your first post in this topic. That’s all I’m going to say.[/quote]

I don’t listen to idiots like you.

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Bobby Mr. Bobby
item.description:
@Mr_Bobby wrote:

runefreak10:

Remove them altogether. Why? I’m the 9th server on the server status page and no one even attempts logging into my server. It’s honestly bullshit the amount of time I put into it and no one ever plays it. 2 years ago I’d get 50 players within the hour of posting the server, and it was on page 2. Sponsored servers fucked everything up in my opinion.

Freaking this ^ just all of this ^

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:22, topic:365368”]Remove them altogether. Why? I’m the 9th server on the server status page and no one even attempts logging into my server. It’s honestly bullshit the amount of time I put into it and no one ever plays it. 2 years ago I’d get 50 players within the hour of posting the server, and it was on page 2. Sponsored servers fucked everything up in my opinion.[/quote]QFT

please pleeasseeeee remove sponsored servers </3

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:31, topic:365368”]Either way, if you guys think MoparScape is dying, my suggestion is to invest some of the sponsored server money into advertisements (i.e. through google) for MoparScape to get the word out that RuneScape servers are very much alive and well here. It will bring a lot of newcomers to RSPS here (they’ll be on some site, see the MoparScape ad, “what’s a private server?” etc.) but it would do well to revive this community with some fresh new blood.[/quote]I was going to suggest that in a previous topic about where the money from the status page was going, but I wasn’t sure if it was a good idea.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:32, topic:365368”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461573.msg3377802#msg3377802 date=1287783548]
There is a reason people will pay more if there are less slots somewhere. Reducing the number of sponsored slots does not change the percent of people that will click on sponsored servers (we’ll call them ‘sponsored’ people) instead of the normal servers. All it does is spread the ‘sponsored’ people (people that click on the first shiny thing they see) between 5 servers instead of 10.

EDIT - I just want it to be known that I do not dislike or not support this idea, I just don’t see what good it will do.
[/quote]

I don’t think there are ‘sponsored people’ who will only use sponsored servers. I think some people won’t click off the first page, but if the ‘other’ servers are more visible I think they will get more use.[/quote]It’s not that they will only use sponsored servers, it’s that they use the sponsored servers because people think that they are better than the normal servers.

@ORP - There was a thread about that, MITB asked for suggestions. (besides buying the server, client and update server)

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:30, topic:365368”]There is a reason people will pay more if there are less slots somewhere. Reducing the number of sponsored slots does not change the percent of people that will click on sponsored servers (we’ll call them ‘sponsored’ people) instead of the normal servers. All it does is spread the ‘sponsored’ people (people that click on the first shiny thing they see) between 5 servers instead of 10.

EDIT - I just want it to be known that I do not dislike or not support this idea, I just don’t see what good it will do.[/quote]

I don’t think there are ‘sponsored people’ who will only use sponsored servers. I think some people won’t click off the first page, but if the ‘other’ servers are more visible I think they will get more use.

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Either way, if you guys think MoparScape is dying, my suggestion is to invest some of the sponsored server money into advertisements (i.e. through google) for MoparScape to get the word out that RuneScape servers are very much alive and well here. It will bring a lot of newcomers to RSPS here (they’ll be on some site, see the MoparScape ad, “what’s a private server?” etc.) but it would do well to revive this community with some fresh new blood.

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

There is a reason people will pay more if there are less slots somewhere. Reducing the number of sponsored slots does not change the percent of people that will click on sponsored servers (we’ll call them ‘sponsored’ people) instead of the normal servers. All it does is spread the ‘sponsored’ people (people that click on the first shiny thing they see) between 5 servers instead of 10.

EDIT - I just want it to be known that I do not dislike or not support this idea, I just don’t see what good it will do.

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The ‘reason’ would be because 5 is less than 10, so perhaps the ‘other’ servers would get more traffic, they would certainly be brought up higher on the page.

I’m not going to increase the minimum bid either, I see no reason to.

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:23, topic:365368”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=461573.msg3377254#msg3377254 date=1287710887]
Remove them altogether. Why? I’m the 9th server on the server status page and no one even attempts logging into my server. It’s honestly bullshit the amount of time I put into it and no one ever plays it. 2 years ago I’d get 50 players within the hour of posting the server, and it was on page 2. Sponsored servers fucked everything up in my opinion.
[/quote]I must admit that DavidScape (which had been running for almost 2 years also) starting loosing players immediately after the introduction of the sponsored server. Eventually it led to me shutting down.

This may be taking a long shot, but I think that the premium servers have actually reduced the amount of development that goes on here. Why? Because no one bothers putting any efforts into servers, because there is no way that they can get a lot of players without spending a lot of money. It might even a contributing factor as to why MoparScape is dying. (Note, I said contributing, not THE reason)[/quote]

I’d actually have to agree with that theory.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:23, topic:365368”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=461573.msg3377254#msg3377254 date=1287710887]
Remove them altogether. Why? I’m the 9th server on the server status page and no one even attempts logging into my server. It’s honestly bullshit the amount of time I put into it and no one ever plays it. 2 years ago I’d get 50 players within the hour of posting the server, and it was on page 2. Sponsored servers fucked everything up in my opinion.
[/quote]I must admit that DavidScape (which had been running for almost 2 years also) starting loosing players immediately after the introduction of the sponsored server. Eventually it led to me shutting down.

This may be taking a long shot, but I think that the premium servers have actually reduced the amount of development that goes on here. Why? Because no one bothers putting any efforts into servers, because there is no way that they can get a lot of players without spending a lot of money. It might even a contributing factor as to why MoparScape is dying. (Note, I said contributing, not THE reason)[/quote]

Yeah. And it seriously pisses me off. I don’t care if he’s getting money for it. I want my players that I deserve, and I’m not going to pay 300 fucking dollars for them. Some mother fucker can download a source someone made and put it online and all of a sudden get 300-500 players on it just because they have the money to make that happen? No, fuck that. We need to go back 2 years.

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“T3arful, post:20, topic:365368”]What exactly do you plan to achieve by lowering it? I don’t think it will make a difference at all, except the bids will just be higher.

Sponsored servers help the site go into better development with people who’d like to sell Mopar work.

They don’t help any development at all. It’s just rich 12yrolds with money downloading and running the latest piece of shit then paying for it to be sponsored.

Um yes the money does go towards development; http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,345848.0.html[/quote]He’s not talking about the money, he’s talking about how the status page does not promote development directly.

Read full topic

item.title: Reducing sponsored server positions?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:14, topic:365368”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461573.msg3376917#msg3376917 date=1287695116]

I think having five would bring a lot more attention to the non-sponsored. I can agree with this idea a lot.
[/quote]Having less slots does not remove any of the attention from the sponsored servers. In fact, having less makes players think “Wow, only 5 have sponsored? They must be good!”
I think we need either 10 or 0.

Then the whole point of this suggestion being made is quite useless because now that I think about it; your about about that. Because a lot of people would want to go the sponsored servers the most than the normal ones. Then again the traffic that comes to MoparScape as far as the server status is I believe the Sponsored server and MoparScape is the first one who have a status page out of the three big RSPS communities? Therefore MoparScape has a lot of reputation just because of it.[/quote]

Sponsored servers help the site go into better development with people who’d like to sell Mopar work.

And, just because there is 5 instead of 10, doesn’t mean anything but there is 5 less.
If people don’t seem intrested in the 5 servers, they can just go to any other server. It increase the chances of having more traffic to non sponsored servers.

Read full topic
